txt.en: 'What have you found, [placeholder]?'
'Éowyn!'
'And you, Dolenthol?'
Instance: A Waxing Moon
'See if you can find a better view from above!'
'What is it?'
'Perhaps you are right...'
'In time of darkness and doubt, I send thee tidings of hope.'
'I have beheld Minas Ithil, and it wakes in my heart an ache I had thought never again to feel.'
'I knew Gondolin of old, and thy stronghold is as like to it as any could now build.'
'Some of the evils visited upon this place cannot be undone.'
'Not all harms can be healed, yet much of worth can still be saved.'
'Oft it is the way of Men to destroy that which no longer pleases them...'
'...rather than taking the care to mend it.'
'Yet it is my hope that some fondness for this vale endures in thee.'
'For while growing things endure...'
'Our Enemy is cruel, and his throngs know naught of mercy.'
'But I have seen the courage of my people and thine proven many times.'
'Let us all search Uialrond and see if we do not find what eludes us.'
'As yet, I have seen no sign of evil, but still I fear something is amiss....'
'What if we were not sealed out?'
'But instead something was sealed in....'
'What would you ask of us, Prince Faramir?'
'As you wish.'
'Have you found anything, [placeholder]?'
'Only dust, Prince Faramir.'
'Wait a moment...'
'Can you see something from up there?'
'What is this?'
'Prince Faramir, I...'
'...with care we can wash the Enemy’s foulness from the land.'
'It is me, my love, and here I stand with you until Minas Ithil is healed.'
